pros: Supportive management, good pay, many opportunities to learn and grow. Supportive staff.
cons: Short staff on the weekends

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Taunton, MA
pros: Friendly, busy, always on the go
cons: No raises, no bonus, hard time getting breaks

pros: There are some good staff members that work there.
cons: Poor management and no communication poor pay.

job_title: Staff Nurse (RN), Emergency Room in Taunton, MA
pros: newer ED, better equipment than many, some employees actually seem to care about patients
cons: Poor support from management Poor support for nurses in general in healthcare, which is evident here. Poor support among staff. Some of the full time doctors are unkind. There are many cliques here on days and evenings, so be prepared to either suck up or get shoved in the yellow area with zero help. Everyday.

review_title: Its a great place to start
pros: This is a small great hospital to start working at out of school. There's new school and old timers to show you around.
cons: Management doesn't know how to manage much of anything and any good managers do not stay for long.

review_title: It’s a good stepping stone job if you want to work in healthcare
job_title: Patient Access Representative in Taunton, MA
pros:
- you see real hospital situations emergency/medflights/psych.
-if you like medicine you can get a good feel on where you’d work well and fit in.
cons:
-the management WILL NOT help you at all and WILL throw you under the bus.
- also won’t be properly trained or updated on training practices

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Taunton, MA
pros: Coworkers were wonderful! Unlimited working potential (always short handed)
cons: Management isn’t efficient; chronically understaffed;

pros: really nice staff at all levels
cons: shortage of covering ancillary services

pros:
Small staff
Friendly staff
Small Hospital
Not always busy
cons:
Always short staffed
Over worked
Long drive

review_title: Nice co-workers but little is done to improve the hospital
job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician in Taunton, MA
pros: I enjoy working with my fellow co-workers at this hospital. They were very nice to me right out of college and I felt needed and depended on.
cons: I know I came here out of college but the pay is really low; however, I hear this hospital pays well for experianced workers. Management is frusrating. Every time I go to them for significant issues that need to be addressed nothing is done to fix it. Nurses are very rude on the phone, it's extremely unprofessional! Moral is low since improvements to the hospital are nonexistant. There are so many holes in the schedual, and no where near enough staff to fill it all, because of this the staff is over worked and stressed. This problem is hospital wide.

review_title: Ok if you don't take it too seriously.
pros: As a non professional (not being a doctor or nurse) it was a good place to learn whether or not you liked the medical field.  Hours could be flexible if you wanted them and something interesting was always happening.
cons: If you weren't one of the nurses or doctors you were lower than dirt.  While learning the ropes if you did something wrong you were either yelled at or huffed at like you were some type of bumbling idiot.  A lot of cattiness went on amongst my co-workers with a general disrespect to the supervisor.  Made for a stressful work environment in an already stressful situation.

pros: None since this hospital was bought by Steward
cons:
Horrible upper management - constantly changing
Unhappy employees
Disgruntled community
Terrible communication on all levels
Human Resources - totally disorganized

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Taunton, MA
pros: The nurses are experienced and work well together.  The providers appreciate the the nurses for their expertise and experience.
cons: Nursing assignments are busy often forced to work through lunch breaks.  Often times not enough ancillary staff so more work falls on the nurse's shoulders.  Unable to use earned vacation time time due to staffing issues.

pros: So the only major thing keeping me here is it is close to home which is convenient with kids in school. The benefit package is decent. Monday through Friday schedule with no overtime/weekends/on-call
cons: They do not pay their employees enough. Policies seem to differ from dept to dept. Managers seem to hire their friends first.

pros: The people who work there treat each other like family and for the most part, everyone gets along great and support each other.
cons: Management is mostly concerned with profits, especially since Steward bought the hospital.  Short staffing is a big issue.

job_title: Food Service Aid in Taunton, MA
pros:
-friendly managers
-were willing to work with you around school/other jobs
cons:
-didn't receive much opportunity to communicate ideas for improvement
-some problems with having/getting protective equipment such as oven gloves
-managers weren't always aware of proper food safety techniques

pros: The people are great, the facility and offerings are top notch.
